item.description:
Klezmer & Beyond, a performance with latkes, drinks, and more!

Come join us for a musical journey from traditional Yiddish melodies to contemporary jazz influences, with food, wine, and a taste of dancing!

Saturday, December 5, 2009 - 8pm

Join us for an evening of traditional (and not so traditional!) Jewish music featuring pianist Hankus Netsky, violinst Yaeko Miranda Elmaleh, flutist and bass clarinetist Linda Chase, multi-instrumentalist Andy Blickenderfer, and vocalist Jessica Kate Meyer.
Netsky, founder and director of the Klezmer Conservatory Band, has been one of the primary figures in the klezmer revival, and is not only a master of tradtional klezmer styles but takes Jewish music into new territories by fusing it with contemporary jazz influences and more. Come for a lively evening of music and a taste of dancing!

Tickets: $16-$25

For tickets, call 781-395-0402 or visit www.springstep.org





WORKSHOPS
Click Here to Register for Workshops Online!

Sunday, December 6, 1:00-2:30pm:
Instant Klezmer Music Workhop
Learn to play Klezmer music in a flash from Hankus Netsky
($15 in advance and $20 at the door)

Sunday, December 6, 3:00-4:30pm:
Klezmer Dance
Dancing for the whole family with live music & a great caller!
($6-$10)
(Presented by the Boston Workmenâ€™s Circle)
